title: Create global configuration for scheduler URL and social links
progressNotes: # Ralph Progress Log  This file tracks the progress and learnings from Ralph iterations. Each completed task should add an entry here for future reference.  ## Recent Iterations  <!-- Ralph will append progress entries here automatically -->  ## Task SETUP-002: Global Configuration for Scheduler URL and Social Links  **Completed:** January 18, 2026  **Changes Made:** - Created `src/config.js` with global configuration for scheduler URL and social links - Added scheduler configuration with URL and label (defaults to Calendly-style URL) - Added social links array with LinkedIn, GitHub, Google Scholar, and Medium - Configuration supports environment variable overrides (SCHEDULER_URL, LINKEDIN_URL, etc.) - Created `tests/config.test.js` with comprehensive tests for configuration structure - Tests validate scheduler properties, social links array, and required fields  **Files Created:** - `src/config.js` - Global configuration module with scheduler and social links - `tests/config.test.js` - Jest tests for configuration validation  **Configuration Features:** - Scheduler URL via `config.scheduler.url` (env: SCHEDULER_URL) - Scheduler button label via `config.scheduler.label` (env: not applicable) - Social links array with name, URL, and optional icon properties - Environment variable support for all URLs (fallback to placeholder URLs) - JSDoc type definitions for IDE autocomplete support  **Related Tasks:** - Depends on: SETUP-001 (completed) - Enables: US-005 (Contact/Booking Flow), US-006 (Trust & Bio Section), US-007 (SEO & Performance)  ## Patterns Discovered  - Always check for existing patterns in AGENTS.md before implementing new features - Prefer established libraries and frameworks already used in the project - Follow the existing code style and naming conventions - Test thoroughly before marking tasks complete  ## Common Issues Resolved  <!-- Document solutions to problems encountered during development -->  ## Performance Optimizations  <!-- Track performance improvements and best practices discovered -->
